pr_title: Updated README to mention that macOS is not supported at this time.

timeline.message: Updated README to mention that macOS is not supported at this time.

timeline.bodyText:
I thought macOS and OS X were the same thing, I've been using the name interchangeably.
According to this wired article OSX is the old name and macOS is the new name since Sierra.  I would just go with macOS to avoid confusion but maybe other have different thoughts?
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: I would just state that it's currently unsupported on OS X/MacOS, not that it currently doesn't build. The current build issues may get fixed, but until we have continuous tests for building the conda environment on OS X/MacOS we cannot claim to officially support it.
